Description: Rim sherd of Attic black-figured pottery open vessel, probably a Droop cup with handle root; rim offset inside and out; interior glazed black, with added red band below offset rim; exterior: offset black rim, reserved at junction with handle zone with band below; in reserved handle zone, black-figure decoration consisting of part of male figure to right (head with hair in added red remaining); on upper left at break part of possible club; black blob as filling ornament; black around handle root at right.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The suffix "13" was added by the British Museum's Naukratis cataloguing project to distinguish the sherd from the other 1912.37 sherds.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 426, no. B676) (labelled 1912.37.5)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0594) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
